name: Card

jtbd.functional: Group related content with clear visual boundaries. A container that establishes content hierarchy through elevation and structure.
jtbd.affordance: Bordered or elevated rectangle with header/body/footer slots. Users recognize this as a self-contained content unit. Interactive variant communicates clickability through hover elevation.
jtbd.emotional: Creates visual order. Cards reduce cognitive load by chunking information into digestible units.

anatomy.card: .t-card — Outer container with border, radius, and overflow hidden
anatomy.header: .t-card__header — Top section for title and actions
anatomy.footer: .t-card__footer — Bottom section for actions and metadata
anatomy.media: .t-card__media — Full-width image/video slot with 16:9 aspect ratio

accessibility.role: article (for standalone content) or region with aria-label (for grouped content)
accessibility.interactive: Interactive cards should use <a> or <button> as the root, or have a clickable child that covers the card area
accessibility.keyboard: Interactive cards must be focusable and activatable via Enter/Space
accessibility.screenReader: Card heading should be a proper heading level. Content structure should be semantic HTML.

knownIssues: Interactive card uses transform scale on active — may cause layout shift
Media slot has fixed 16:9 aspect ratio — no flexibility for other ratios
